Generates an intermediate football image for the shooting animation.

Specified by:
generateIntermediateFootballImage in interface comp102x.assignment.GameLogic
Parameters:
depthImages - The array contains an array of football images of different depths.
initialStep - The initial step of the shooting animation.
currentStep - The current step of the shooting animation
finalStep - The final step of the shooting animation.
initialScale - The initial scale of the football
finalScale - The final scale of the football
initialX - The initial x position of the football.
finalX - The final x positions of the football.
initialY - The initial y position of the football.
finalY - The final y positions of the football.
Returns:
The selected depth image of football.

updateGoalPositions

public void updateGoalPositions(comp102x.assignment.Goal[][] goals)
Step1: At every array cell, check three conditions
A: its Type (if it movable/stationary)
B: its Hit state (True/False)
C: and whether it has been swaped once or not in the current method call

Step2: Generate randome number between -1 and 1 and assign to varialbes r1 and r2 respecitvely

Step3: Sum up current cell i-index and r1 and assign it to varialbe t1 and j-index and r2

Sum up current cell j-index and r2 and assign it to varialbe t2

Step4: Strategy to pick the nearest neighbours
A: if the current cell i-index and t1 are similar and j-index and t2 are similar, this
referes to the cell itself and is discarded and cell to itself is not neighbour.
B: check the bound such that following conditions are fullfilled
t1 >= 0 && t2 >= 0 && t1 < row && t2 < col

Step5: In the if statement of Step4B, check if the goal is not being Hit (.)

Specified by:
updateGoalPositions in interface comp102x.assignment.GameLogic
Parameters:
goals - .
